page.title: 04INDUSTRIAL DECLINE
page.content: {Steel production}has been carried on the{Derwent Howe}site workington since 19th century .In{1974}the Bessamar method of producing steel was stopped .In{1981}the{steel works closed with the loss of over{300 jobs the coke ovens ,pig casting machines,and the huge sintar plant which lime and coke together were all scrapped.This left a large area of land at Workington.The old Ironworks buildings are used for displays.A slag bank 220 feet high is now being dismantled.BSC were interested in creating new jobs,so the{Moss Bay {Enterprise Trust (Mobet)}was set up to encourage hi-tech firms to come to Workington.
